content: getting a 404 for http://build.fhir.org/branches/R4B/medicalproductdefinition.html. (and some of the other medication resources). From the page: http://build.fhir.org/branches/R4B/ballot-intro.html
Where are you seeing the bad link? Unfortunately link checking isn't turned on right now

What is the process to get jira tickets applied to R4B? - Security has noticed that the whole HCS section of the security-labels.html page is broken as the content was moved to THO but the links were not updated. We now have a recommended replacement html that fixes this, and enhances the explanation. -- https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-11071
It should also be a Technical Correction, not a Change Request

so there is no process as to what is legitimate change to R4B? I thought there was some control to limit the scope.
given that it needs to be applied to R5... does it get cloned?
The rule is that if it's a technical correction, it's a candidate to be applied. The rules on what constitutes a technical correction are pretty strict.
okay, what about the cloning question? How do I do the paperwork for applying the same change to R4B and also R5?

What we have been doing is marking the R4B ones and applying them to R4B with an expectation that we'll cherry-pick the changes and move them into R5 too. However, probably worth discussing specific process on an upcoming call.
so I should first apply to R4B and hold off applying to R5? If so, doesn't that put the upcoming ballot of R5 in a strange state?
You don't have to hold off applying to R5. Fine to apply to both. Probably even better to do that.
